perturbation.original_text: Subject to Emdeon's compliance with the provisions of this Agreement, Emdeon is hereby authorized and licensed to use the Content by making such Content available to third parties verbatim or as source material via the Software. Such license is a non-exclusive, non-transferrable and worldwide license and shall include the right to use, reproduce, copy and publish the Content solely in connection with the Software. Emdeon may determine the placement and formatting of the Content in the Software, but may not change the substance of the Content to any extent whatsoever without WebMD's written approval of the change.
perturbation.changed_text: Subject to Emdeon's compliance with the provisions of this Agreement, Emdeon is hereby authorized and licensed to use the Content by making such Content available to third parties verbatim or as source material via the Software. Such license is a non-exclusive, non-transferrable and worldwide permit and shall include the right to utilize, duplicate, replicate and disseminate the Content solely in connection with the Software. Emdeon may determine the placement and formatting of the Content in the Software, but may alter the essence of the Content without WebMD's consent.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'license' and 'permit' are used interchangeably, creating confusion about the scope of rights granted. The original text prohibits Emdeon from changing the content's substance without approval, while the modified version allows alteration without consent, creating a direct contradiction.

perturbation.original_text: WebMD's relationship to Emdeon shall be that of an independent contractor. Nothing herein shall create any association, partnership, joint venture or agency relationship between WebMD and Emdeon. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, it is expressly understood and agreed that WebMD shall have no authority whatsoever to make any representations or commitments to or enter into any agreements with any third party on behalf of Emdeon.
perturbation.changed_text: WebMD's relationship to Emdeon shall be that of an independent provider. This arrangement might imply a collaborative partnership. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, it is expressly understood and agreed that WebMD shall have the authority to make representations or commitments to enter into agreements with any third party on behalf of Emdeon.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'independent contractor' is switched with 'independent provider' and directly implies a potential collaboration, contradicting the original intent of independence. The text then states that WebMD does have authority to act on behalf of Emdeon, which creates a contradiction with the original prohibition.

perturbation.original_text: Confidential Information also includes any information described in this Section which either party obtains from a third party under an obligation of confidentiality. Confidential Information does not include any data or information which the receiving party can demonstrate with competent written proof: (i) was already known to it at the time of disclosure; (ii) was independently developed by it without reference to the disclosing party's Confidential Information; (iii) is in the public domain; (iv) was rightfully disclosed to it by a third party without obligation of confidentiality; or (v) is required to be disclosed pursuant to any statutory or regulatory authority or court order, provided the disclosing party is given prompt written notice of such requirement and the scope of such disclosure is limited to the extent possible.
perturbation.changed_text: Private Information also includes any information described in this Section which either party obtains from a third party under an obligation of privacy. Private Information includes any data or information which the receiving party can demonstrate with oral proof: (i) was already known to it at the time of disclosure; (ii) was independently developed by it without reference to the disclosing party's Private Information; (iii) is in the public domain; (iv) was rightfully disclosed to it by a third party without any obligation of privacy; or (v) is required to be disclosed pursuant to any statutory or regulatory authority or court order, provided that there is no notice given, and the scope of disclosure is not limited.
perturbation.explanation: The use of 'Confidential Information' changed to 'Private Information' causes ambiguity. The text now states that oral proof is enough, and also that no notice needs to be given, nor does the scope of the disclosure need to be limited which goes directly against what was initially intended.
